Situation1: They notice a few pool chairs are slightly misaligned but still usable.
Expectation2: Providing spiritual guidance and counseling to community members
Situation2: A long-time congregant requested a private meeting soon because of mounting family stress.
Story: As I walked along the pool deck, the late afternoon sun glinting off the water, I noticed a few pool chairs were out of line. They weren’t blocking any paths, but I knew part of my duty as a lifeguard was to keep everything orderly and safe. I reached down to straighten one, but my phone buzzed in my pocket. It was a message from Brother Ahmed, a long-time congregant. He sounded desperate—his family was going through a crisis, and he needed to talk to me as soon as possible. As the imam, I knew how much he relied on my guidance, especially in moments like this. I looked at the chairs, then at the phone in my hand, feeling the weight of both roles pressing on me. The pool needed to be ready for the evening rush, but Ahmed’s voice in my mind reminded me that spiritual support couldn’t wait. My heart pounded as I stood there, torn between the quiet order of the pool and the urgent needs of my community.
